info.title: Twilio Messaging API
info.description: A Message instance resource represents an inbound or outbound message. When you send an SMS or MMS message via the REST API, use the <Message> verb in TwiML, or someone sends a message to one of your Twilio numbers Twilio creates a Message instance resource.

get.description: Provides information on industry conferences, webinars, lectures and trade missions organized by the U.S. Dept. of Commerce

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns office locations based on ISO alpha-2 country codes.

parameters.name: industry
parameters.description: Searches for specific controlled industry names

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Searches for a match within the event_name and description fields.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the maximum amount of hits to be returned.

get.description: This API provides metadata for country and industry reports that are produced by ITAs trade experts and are available in ITAs online market research library.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns office locations based on ISO alpha-2 country codes.

parameters.name: industry
parameters.description: Returns market research reports for a specific industry.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Returns market research reports for a match in the description or title fields.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the maximum amount of hits to be returned.

get.description: This API provides contact and address information for all of ITAs domestic and international export assistance centers.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Returns office locations based on city name

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns office locations based on ISO alpha-2 country codes.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Returns office locations for a match within the post or office name fields.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the maximum amount of hits to be returned.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Returns locations for export assistance centers located in a specific U.S. State or Dependent Area.

post.description: A Message instance resource represents an inbound or outbound message. When you send an SMS or MMS message via the REST API, use the <Message> verb in TwiML, or someone sends a message to one of your Twilio numbers Twilio creates a Message instance resource.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: Account ID

parameters.name: ApplicationSid
parameters.description: Twilio will POST MessageSid as well as MessageStatus=sent or MessageStatus=failed to the URL in the MessageStatusCallback property of this Application. If the StatusCallback parameter above is also passed, the Application's MessageStatusCallback parameter will take precedence.

parameters.name: Body
parameters.description: The text of the message you want to send, limited to 1600 characters.

parameters.name: From
parameters.description: A Twilio phone number enabled for the type of message you wish to send. Only phone numbers or short codes purchased from Twilio work here; you cannot (for example) spoof messages from your own cell phone number.

parameters.name: MediaUrl
parameters.description: The URL of the media you wish to send out with the message. gif , png and jpeg content is currently supported and will be formatted correctly on the recipient's device. Other types are also accepted by the API. The media size limit is 5MB. If you wish to send more than one image in the message body, please provide multiple MediaUrls values in the POST request. You may include up to 10 MediaUrls per message.

parameters.name: StatusCallback
parameters.description: A URL that Twilio will POST to each time your message status changes to one of the following: failed, sent, delivered, or undelivered. Twilio will POST the MessageSid along with the other standard request parameters as well as MessageStatus and ErrorCode.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: The destination phone number. Format with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format). For 'To' numbers without a '+', Twilio will use the same country code as the 'From' number. Twilio will also attempt to handle locally formatted numbers for that country code (e.g. (415) 555-1212 for US, 07400123456 for GB). If you are sending to a different country than the 'From' number, you must include a '+' and the country code to ensure proper delivery.

get.description: This resource represents an individual SMS or MMS message.

parameters.name: MessageSid
parameters.description: The message ID.

parameters.name: This resource represents an individual SMS or MMS message.
parameters.description: The account ID.
